_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Farm Product Raw Material Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
MN Valley Ag Co-op
600 4th street SW.
Montgomery, MN 56069

FOR FURTHER INFORMATION CONTACT WALTER MILLER 507-364-5059

RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN-EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

1.FACILITY POLICY

THE OWNERS AND THE MANAGEMENT AND THE EMPLOYEES OF MN VALLEY AG CO-OP ARE COMMITTED TO THE PREVENTION OF ANY ACCIDENTAL RELEASES OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA AND PROPANE.. IF ANY ACCIDENTAIL REALEASE SHOULD OCCUR THE FACILITY IS PREPARED TO WORK WITH THE LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT OR OTHER AUTHORITIES TO MITIGATE AND REALEASE AND TO MINIMIZE THE IMPACT OF THE REALEASE ON PEOPLE AND THE ENVIROMENT.

2.FACILITY INFORMATION

THE PRIMARY ACTIVITY OF THE FACILITY IS THE STORAGE AND THE BLENDING OF FERTILIZER FOR SALE TO FARMERS.  THE FACILITY ALSO DELEVERS PROPANE AND FUELS TO RESIDENTIAL, COMMERCIAL, AND AGRICULTURAL CUSTOMERS.  ANHYDROUS AMMONIA IS RECEIVED, STORED, AND DISTRIBUTED FOR DIRECT APPLICATION AS A CROP NUTRIENT FOR FARMERS. THE MAXIMUM QUANTITY OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA STORED WOULD BE 376200 POUNDS IN OUR 30,000-GALLON TANK AND NURSE TANKS.  THE MAXIMUM QUANTITY HANDLED WOULD BE 40,000 POUNDS WHEN UNLOADING A TANK TRUCK.  THE MAXIMUM QUANTITY OF PROPANE STORED AT ONE TIME IS 133400 POUNDS.  THE MAXIMUM QUANTITY HANDLED WOULD BE 37,800 POUNDS WHEN UNLOADING A TANKER TRUCK.

3. WORST CASE AND ALTERNATE WORST CASE RELEASE SCENARIO

THE FACILTY HAS DEVELOPED A WORST CASE AND ALTERNATE WORST CASE RELEASE SCENARIO; HOWEVER IT HAS BEEN WITHELD FROM THIS EXECUTIVE SUMMARY AS SECURITY SENSITIVE INFORMATION AS REQUESTED BY EPA.

4. ACCIENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM

THE FACILITY HAS IMPLEMETED THE PROVISIONS OF A?SAFETY REQUIREMENTS FOR HT STORAGE AND HANDLING OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA, K-61.1A? PUBLISHED BY THE AMERICAN NATIONAL STANDARDS INSTITUTE, INC AND THE STANDARDS OF THE U.S. OCCUPATIONAL SAFETY AND HEALTH ADMINISTRATION, 29CFR 1910.111, A?STRORAGE AND HANDLING OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIAA?. IN ADDITION, MN DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE RULES.

5. FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

THERE HAVE BEEN NO ACCIDENTS TO REPORT

.

6. EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

THE FACILITY HAS
A.    A WRITTEN EMERGENCY ACTION PLAN IN ACCORDANCE WITH OSHA STANDARDS 29 CFR 1910.38
B.    PROVIDED STATE AND LOCAL AUTHORITES THE EMERGENCY PLANNING AND COMMUNITY RIGHT TO KNOW INFORMATION AS REQUIRED UND SARA TITLE III. (EPCRA)
C.    COORDINATED WITH LOCAL EMERGENCY RESPONDERS

7. PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY  

SAFETY IMPROVEMENT IS AN ON-GOING PROCESS AT THE FACILITY; PERIOIDI EVALUAITONS ARE PREFORMED TO ASSESS THE MAINTENANCE OF SAFE CONDITIONS.  THERE ARE NO ADDITIONAL SPECIFIC ANHYDROUS AMMONIA SAFETY RECOMMENDATIONS FOR IMPLEMENTATION AT THIS TIME.
